page.title: 10Dalton centenary celebration
page.content: In 1985 our parish church of St. Mary's is a hundred years old so there have been some centenary celebrations.The first service was held in February to celebrate the first service held in February 1885.To start the celebrations a peal of bells was rung on the Saturday.The curate led the service because we had no vicar at that time.The church school choir sang'At the name of Jesus'.The Arch Deacon Peter Vaughan preached the sermon.Some students,who were on a church mission, did a play for us. In the church centre,after the service, there was a large centenary cake in the shape of the church baked by a parishoner and everyone in church had a piece of the birthday cake.
